page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = CreateTestCertificate(CertificateFile as C, PrivateKeyFile as C, PrivateKeyPassword as C [, DaysCertificateIsValid = 365 as N [, CountryCode = "US" as C [, State = "MA" as C [, Locality = "Burlington" as C [, Organization = "Alpha Software Customer" as C [, OrganizationalUnit = "Development Test" as C [, CommonName = "www.mydomain.com" as C [, Comment = "Self Signed Server Test Certificate" as C [, ServerName = "localhost" as C [, SerialNumber = 0 as N ]]]]]]]]]])

argument.name: Result_Flag
argument.description: TRUE (.T.) if the operation was successful; otherwise FALSE (.F.).

argument.name: CertificateFile
argument.description: The path and name of the SSL Server Certificate.

argument.name: PrivateKeyFile
argument.description: The path and name of the private key file.

argument.name: PrivateKeyPassword
argument.description: The password for the private key file.

argument.name: Comment = "Self Signed Server Test Certificate"
argument.description: Optional. Default = "Self Signed Server Test Certificate".

page.description: Create a server test certificate using an existing private key.
page.discussion: The INET::SSLContext::CreateTestCertificate() method creates a server test certificate using an existing private key.
page.example: dim ctx as INET::SSLContext if ctx.CreateTestCertificate(CertFile, KeyFile, Password, 1024, "US", "MA", "Burlington", "Alpha Software, Inc.", "Dev", "localhost", "Homemade", "localhost", 12345) Result = "Certificate successfully created" else Result = "Error creating certificate: " + ctx.callresult.text end if ui_msg_box("Create certificate: " + CertFile, Result
